newsitem.title: USA: Cryomedical gets ruling vs former exec.
newsitem.headline: Cryomedical gets ruling vs former exec.

text.p: Cryomedical Sciences Inc said Tuesday a U.S. district court ruled on July 2 one of its former researchers must quit working for its competitor Endocare Inc.

Cryomedical said the court ordered Endocare's vice president of research and developement Zhao Hua Chang to end his employment and prohibited him from performing services for Endocare in any capacity.
The Circuit Court for Montgomery County, Md., issued the injunction pending the trial on the merits of Cryomedical's claims against Chang and Endocare, the company said.
Cryomedical said the court stated the non-compete provisions between the company and Chang were valid and enforceable.

The company is seeking $10 million in compensatory damages and $20 million in punitive damages in the lawsuit, claiming Chang and Endocare misappropiated trade secrets and confidential information. A spokesman said he expected the suit to go to trial within the next six to 12 moths.
Endocare of Irving, Calif., said in February the suit is without merit and that it intended to defend it vigorously. A company official was not immediately available for comment.
